cards.name: Caterpie
cards.text: Perhaps because it would like to grow up quickly, it has a voracious appetite, eating a hundred leaves a day.

cards.name: Metapod
cards.text: Its shell is filled with a thick liquid. All of the cells throughout its body are being rebuilt in preparation for evolution.

cards.name: Butterfree
cards.text: Its wings are covered in toxic scales. If it finds bird Pokémon going after Caterpie, Butterfree sprinkles its scales on them to drive them off.

cards.name: Paras
cards.text: Whether it's due to a lack of moisture or a lack of nutrients, in Alola the mushrooms on Paras don't grow up quite right.

cards.name: Scyther
cards.text: Its two sharp scythes are more than just weapons. It uses them with dexterity to dress its prey before eating.

cards.name: Pinsir-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Guillotine-GX
attacks.text: (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Charmander
cards.text: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.

cards.name: Charmeleon
cards.text: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe. It then tears up the fallen opponent with sharp claws.

cards.name: Charizard-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz-GX
attacks.text: (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Magmar
cards.text: Its entire body is burning. When it breathes, the temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames shoot out!

cards.name: Psyduck
cards.text: Using psychokinesis gives it a headache, so it normally passes the time spacing out and doing as little as possible.

cards.name: Slowpoke
cards.text: Alolan home cooking involves drying Slowpoke tails and then simmering them into a salty stew.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Staryu
cards.text: In many places, there are folktales of stardust falling into the ocean and becoming Staryu.

attacks.name: Numbing Water
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Starmie-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Star Stream
attacks.text: Attach 2 Water Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Magikarp
cards.text: In the distant past, they were fairly strong, but they have become gradually weaker over time.

cards.name: Gyarados-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam-GX
attacks.text: (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Lapras
cards.text: It likes swimming around with people on its back. In the Alola region, it's an important means of transportation over water.

cards.name: Vaporeon
cards.text: Clean, clear waters are its usual habitat. When it's about to be attacked by an invading enemy, it dives into the water to hide.

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

cards.name: Raichu-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spark Ball-GX
attacks.text: (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Voltorb
cards.text: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.

cards.name: Electrode
cards.text: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of "The Bomb Ball."

attacks.name: Electroblast
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Jolteon

abilities.name: Electromagnetic Wall
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

cards.text: Its lungs contain an organ that creates electricity. The crackling sound of electricity can be heard when it exhales.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Zapdos
cards.text: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Hurricane Call
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. For each heads, search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Ekans
cards.text: By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Ekans
cards.text: By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.

cards.name: Arbok

abilities.name: Last Pattern
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, discard 2 random cards from your opponent's hand.

cards.text: The latest research has determined that there are over 20 possible arrangements of the patterns on its stomach.

attacks.name: Rocket Tail
attacks.text: If Jessie & James is in your discard pile, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Koffing
cards.text: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.

cards.name: Weezing

abilities.name: Surrender Now
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is discarded with the effect of Jessie & James, you may have your opponent discard a card from their hand. (They discard that card after the effect of Jessie & James.)

cards.text: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.

cards.name: Jynx
cards.text: It sways its hips to a rhythm all its own. The precise movements of Jynx living in Alola are truly wonderful.

cards.name: Mewtwo-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psycrush-GX
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Mew
cards.text: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.

cards.name: Geodude
cards.text: Geodude that have lived a long life have had all their edges smoothed out until they're totally round. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.

cards.name: Graveler
cards.text: It climbs up cliffs as it heads toward the peak of a mountain. As soon as it reaches the summit, it rolls back down the way it came.

attacks.name: Mudslide
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fighting Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Golem
cards.text: When Golem grow old, they stop shedding their shells. Those that have lived a long, long time have shells green with moss.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 3 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Onix-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Rocky Avalanche-GX
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Cubone
cards.text: The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead mother. According to some, it will evolve when it comes to terms with the pain of her death.

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: They're popular, but they're rare. Trainers who show them off recklessly may be targeted by thieves.

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: They're popular, but they're rare. Trainers who show them off recklessly may be targeted by thieves.

cards.name: Clefable
cards.text: It can't help but hear a pin drop from over half a mile away, so it lives deep in the mountains where there aren't many people or Pokémon.

cards.name: Jigglypuff
cards.text: Recordings of Jigglypuff's strange lullabies can be purchased from department stores. These CDs can be found near the bedding area.

cards.name: Wigglytuff-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rolling Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Lovely Star-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Mr. Mime
cards.text: Its pantomime skills are wonderful. You may become enraptured while watching it, but next thing you know, Mr. Mime has made a real wall.

attacks.name: Happy Mime
attacks.text: Each player draws a card.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Moltres & Zapdos & Articuno-GX
cards.text: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sky Legends-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Fire, Water, and Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 110 damage to 3 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Farfetch'd
cards.text: The plant stalk it holds is its weapon. The stalk is used like a sword to cut all sorts of things.

cards.name: Chansey
cards.text: It seems that other Pokémon's efforts to take its delicious, nutritious egg away from it caused Chansey to get faster at fleeing.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Kangaskhan
cards.text: Kangaskhan protects its child by keeping it in its pouch. It has zero forgiveness for those who harm its child and will beat them down.

attacks.name: Parental Fury
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: The question of why only Eevee has such unstable genes has still not been solved.

attacks.name: Curiosity
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

attacks.name: Spin Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.

cards.name: Snorlax
cards.text: It doesn't do anything other than eat and sleep. When prompted to make a serious effort, though, it apparently displays awesome power.

cards.name: Bill's Analysis
cards.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal up to 2 Trainer cards you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Blaine's Last Stand
cards.text: You can play this card only when it is the last card in your hand.,Draw 2 cards for each Fire Pokémon you have in play.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Brock's Grit
cards.text: Shuffle 6 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Brock's Pewter City Gym
cards.text: Onix-GX (both yours and your opponent's) take 40 less damage from the opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Brock's Training
cards.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Geodude, Graveler, Golem, Onix-GX, Cubone, Rhyhorn, Rhydon, or Sudowoodo.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Erika's Hospitality
cards.text: You can play this card only if you have 4 or fewer other cards in your hand.,Draw a card for each of your opponent's Pokémon in play.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Giovanni's Exile
cards.text: Discard up to 2 of your Benched Pokémon that have no damage counters on them and all cards attached to them.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Jessie & James
cards.text: Each player discards 2 cards from their hand. Your opponent discards first.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Koga's Trap
cards.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Lt. Surge's Strategy
cards.text: You can play this card only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent.,During this turn, you can play 3 Supporter cards (including this card).,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Misty's Cerulean City Gym
cards.text: The attacks of Starmie-GX (both yours and your opponent's) do 40 more damage to the opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Misty's Determination
cards.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, look at the top 8 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Misty's Water Command
cards.text: Move any number of Water Energy from your Pokémon to your Psyduck, Horsea, Staryu, Starmie-GX, Magikarp, Gyarados, or Lapras in any way you like.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Pokémon Center Lady
cards.text: Heal 60 damage and remove all Special Conditions from 1 of your Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Sabrina's Suggestion
cards.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. You may choose a Supporter card you find there and use the effect of that card as the effect of this card.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Moltres & Zapdos & Articuno-GX
cards.text: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sky Legends-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Fire, Water, and Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 110 damage to 3 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Giovanni's Exile
cards.text: Discard up to 2 of your Benched Pokémon that have no damage counters on them and all cards attached to them.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Jessie & James
cards.text: Each player discards 2 cards from their hand. Your opponent discards first.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Moltres & Zapdos & Articuno-GX
cards.text: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sky Legends-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Fire, Water, and Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 110 damage to 3 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
